version.change: .R(expr, list(retType, list(type, type))) now works. See explorations/dotRCallback.R
Added .varDecl() for declaring variable types. This can be of the form .varDecl(x = type, y = type). This is different from the .typeInfo/.typeInfo
Added .typeInfo and .signature for specifying type information for a function. Currently, it has to be the first expression in the body of the function.
Extensive additions for calling back to R from within the compiled code.
Basic subsetting for matrices, data frames.
DataFrameType, MatrixType and ArrayType type classes for dimensioned types.
Fixes for if expressions within loops (for and while) and how to find the next block.
Support for composite conditions, e.g. x == 1 || y < 2, and more than 2 conditions.
Register the function being compiled so that it can call itself recursively, i.e. we can generate code to call the function itself as part of its own body.
getTypes can look up the type of a variable.
